ticket.title: rake rails:freeze:edge not working
ticket.original-body: the zipfile http://dev.rubyonrails.org/archives/rails_edge.zip that the rake fails:freeze:edge task uses appears to not contain up to date code for rails edge. The last modified date on the zip is changing ( http://dev.rubyonrails.org/archives/ ) so it is being regenerated but appears to conatin 2.0.991 all the time, and is not including new commits to rails edge

version.body:
I agree that it's a little annoying that a standard rake task doesn't work. But why not just clone the GitHub repository in vendor/rails?
rails your_app_name cd your_app_name/vendor git clone git://github.com/rails/rails.git
That's it.

rails your_app_name

cd your_app_name/vendor

git clone git://github.com/rails/rails.git

That's it.
version.title: rake rails:freeze:edge not working

version.body: While I agree that cloning the github repo is really simple, if thats going to be the recommended method then the rake take should be removed. Considering the rake task was changed to use the zip file when rails moved to github I think it should probably work too - I'm assuming its just a minor mistake in the script that generates the zip not actually pulling from the edge revision and should be relatively easy to fix. From the announcement about rails premiering n github "If you don’t have git, or don’t enjoy running it on your platform, you need not fear. We’ve set up an automated task to produce a zip file of Rails Edge that’ll be kept up to date all the time: http://dev.rubyonrails.org/archives/rails_edge.zip. This is also what we’ve made the new rake rails:freeze:edge use."
